definition: to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple
to form pairs/to be in couples

sentences.english: It is not every couple that is a pair.
sentences.chinese: 成雙成對多，珠聯璧合少。

sentences.english: I tried to tell him they always hunt
sentences.chinese: 我正想告訴他，它們總是成對地獵食。

sentences.english: The party was full of couples, with no single people.
sentences.chinese: 參加晚會的人全都成雙成對，沒有單身的。

sentences.english: Participants were first presented with, and asked to learn, pairs of words.
sentences.chinese: 參與者先是被呈現並被要求學習成對的詞組。

sentences.english: Some looked like little eels, most have paired teeth at the head end.
sentences.chinese: 有的看上去像小鱔魚，大多數的頭部有着成對的牙齒。

sentences.english: They come at least in pairs, one serving as substratum for the other.
sentences.chinese: 他們至少都是成雙成對，互爲對方的次階層。

sentences.english: No, Pairwise does not use sequential elimination.
sentences.chinese: 沒有，成對不使用順序消除。

sentences.english: There is surely only one conclusion from these twin scientific findings.
sentences.chinese: 這些成對的科學發現中只有一個結論。

sentences.english: The researchers inject pairs of electrons and holes into the germanium.
sentences.chinese: 研究者們注射成對的電子和凹陷到鍺中。

sentences.english: As well as duplicate prints, it required two projectionists.
sentences.chinese: 因爲它不僅需要成對的拷貝，而且還需要兩個放映員。

sentences.english: Evenings bring couples and singles for concert.
sentences.chinese: 夜晚引得成雙成對和單身的男女去聽音樂會。

sentences.english: People see on the streets in pairs, but can only head down to walk.
sentences.chinese: 街上看到別人成雙成對，卻只能低着頭走路。

sentences.english: Due to coupling, a pair of walkers arrive at some synchrony state.
sentences.chinese: 因爲耦合，成對的行走者將進入某種同步狀態。

sentences.english: English words in pairs are one of the most important parts of English idioms.
sentences.chinese: 英語成對詞是英語慣用語的主要組成部分之一。
客人們成雙成對地來了。

sentences.english: As the couples closed upon him he expressed his congratulations .
sentences.chinese: 當那些成雙成對的人走近他時，他向他們表示了祝賀。

definition: can be counted on one's fingers (idiom)/very few
it can clearly be seen (that this is the case)/it is (thus) clear/clear/visible
to view as/to see as/to consider to be/to deem
handed down from ancient times/family heirloom
to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed
to load into/to record/to write into/to enter (data)/to go into (the records)/to go down (in history)
